intro: Sirmuellera robur, commonly known as the robust sirmuellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sirmuellera robur is often found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
